Topic.Title: Should new Etrade CEO file lawsuit against banks and mortgage lenders?

Message.Msg: Why hasn't Etrade attempted one putback of these mortgage portfolios? Their company was damaged more than any other company from toxic mortgages they purchased from companies that likely misrepresented or had false documentation behind the loans.

Topic.Title: E-Trade buyout inevitable

Message.Msg: Totally agree, every market has three main providers and ETFC's platform will never be shut down as it's the #1 platform. Worth a lot more to Wells, Capital One, etc.

Message.Title: I would have relieved you both of your post
Message.Msg: Obama's failing and coverup on Benghazi do not overshadow his criminal acts and coverup on Fast & Furious.

Topic.Title: Should new Etrade CEO file lawsuit against banks and mortgage lenders?

Message.Msg: Depends on who they bought the CDO and mortgages from, Lehman, Bear or one of the other dead banks? I'm sure there are some significant data available to potential buyers of the company, the question I have is how do we get access to this data?

Topic.Title: Should new Etrade CEO file lawsuit against banks and mortgage lenders?

Message.Msg: Etrade has put back mortgages on third parties. This information is clearly disclosed in the 10k. I recall a settlement on HELOCS for around 100mil or so as a final number with that party. I don't really see much opportunity going forward for put backs.

Message.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.
Message.Msg: Not to mention financial sector going up, this means Wells, JPM, BofA, et al can use their shares to buy ETFC. How do we not hit $15 sometime in the next six months?

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: But your general outlook is accurate, in my opinion. Will be difficult for NIM to expand significantly until the Fed stops the money printing presses. I still think that we hit $50 sometime in 2015.

Topic.Title: I would have relieved you both of your post

Message.Msg: Save it for another year and a half.

Message.Title: Etrade remains a compelling buyout candidate
Message.Msg: The deal may already be done. The buyer probably put the new CEO in place to get up to speed.

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: That sounds about right. Depends on if the fed goes out handing out huge wads of cash to homeowners with under water mortgages though doesn't it? That could SIGNIFICANTLY accelerate things.

Topic.Title: Etrade remains a compelling buyout candidate

Message.Msg: Why should I think this is so? Bank earnings are down big. Spreads down, earning assets down, fees down. They need to deploy the cash hoard that is sitting on their balance sheet(s) doing exactly nothing, but costing them interest every day of the week.

Topic.Title: Austerity gets a FAIL!

Message.Msg: Actually my British portfolio GREW in the last quarter of 2012. I didn't start to invest in Britain until the 2nd quarter of the year, by the end of the third I had heavy unrealized losses (though significant dividends paid as compared to US companies) and in the fourth I largely regained those losses. For me, at least, sounds like that British austerity works.

Topic.Title: Etrade remains a compelling buyout candidate

Message.Msg: Within a week of the ink being dry they have to notify stockholders of the sale, so my guess is that if any such deal DOES exist, the ink is definitely not yet dry, though allowing a CEO pick might have been a prerequisite of any potential deal going forth. Depends entirely on what his salary package looks like.

Topic.Title: Etrade remains a compelling buyout candidate

Message.Msg: They can't, the cash hoards represent their required capitalization to hold all that mortgage paper. Provisions against losses and whatnot. Of course once those mortgages are gone all that money frees up.

Topic.Title: Redefining weenies

Message.Msg: Now we know the fit all answer for any tough question: "What difference does it make?"

Topic.Title: Etrade remains a compelling buyout candidate

Message.Msg: I don't think that this baby is in play yet. The company is doing the right things: deleveraging, reducing balance sheet, building strong reserves...let's hope that the regulators will see all of this positively and let the bank release the billions of excess reserves to the parent.

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: $50, a bit optimistic don't you think, there's still much weight to overcome with the bad debt issue. Don't think the head winds will prevail through 2015.

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: But it presumes a few different things: 1. The Fed stops printing money (allowing the market to set interest rates), which should lead to 2. Big expansion in NIM 3. Couple this with increase in accounts and assets 4. more long-term normalized DARTs (which I think are closer to 125,000) 5. more Option/Restricted Stock Management deals with fast growing corporations, which happens as companies get closer to going public. 6. Regulators allow ETFC to upstream $2B in excess capital from bank to parent, allowing parent to return capital to shareholders in some form (share buyback, call the new debt, dividend, etc.). Any return of capital in the form of dividend would have to be counted toward the $50 total price target (meaning if $5 is returned cumulatively between now and 2015, then I would expect a $45 price target). JMHO.

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: okay i'll buy in, let's see. i'm long on E, good luck to you

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: $600 million bottom-line profit is management's target assuming 40% tax rate. Targets take a good while to hit so that isn't happening tomorrow or even in the next year. Suppose DARTS could skyrocket but I don't think that will happen, a good increase probably but not skyrocket.

Topic.Title: ETFC: Rates up = NIM going up. Retail is back = DARTS going up. Real Estate going up = Loan Portfolio going up.

Message.Msg: ETFC has billions in tax loss carryforwards, so I don't think that the company will be paying taxes for a good long time.

Message.Msg: Wouldn't rule it out. If you don't succeeded at first, try, try again. This way they can average down with their home loan portfolio they presenlty have on the books....genius!

Topic.Title: Any Reason To Hold This Stock

Message.Msg: moved up nicely today what is exactly happening with this stock here

Message.Title: Disarm the mentally ill
Message.Msg: The results of several breakthrough studies are offering new insights on gay men, lesbians and bisexuals. Among the key findings: Several studies suggest that gay men, lesbians and bisexuals appear to have higher rates of some mental disorders compared with heterosexuals. Specifically, the studies find: Higher rates of major depression, generalized anxiety disorder and substance use or dependence in lesbian and gay youth. Higher rates of recurrent major depression among gay men. Higher rates of anxiety, mood and substance use disorders, and suicidal thoughts among people ages 15 to 54 with same-sex partners. Higher use of mental health services in men and women reporting same-sex partners.
